Selecting Items for Comparisons

With the View Comparison utility, you can select various subsets of the items currently displayed in the item pane. This feature is particularly useful when you are comparing folders manually.

Depending on what is displayed, some selections result in the same subset of items. For example, if only items with differences are displayed, selecting Item > Select >All Items is identical to selecting Item > Select > All Items With Differences.

If the Use Merge Tracking for Merge Resolution option has been selected from the Item menu, this decision affects the definition used for Needing Merge. The following procedure assumes that the option is selected and notes the differences that occur when this is not the case.

Tip: You can also use the Display drop-down list box on the toolbar to make selections.

To select:

  1. By the existence of the items:

    • All the items that exist in either or both views, choose Select > All Items from the Item or context menu.

    • All the items that exist in only one view, choose Select > All Items Not In Both Views from the Item or context menu.

    • All the items that exist in both views, choose Select > All Items In Both Views from the Item or context menu.

  2. By the differences in the items:

    • All the items that differ (i.e., items that exist in only one view or are different in both views), choose Select > All Items With Differences from the Item or context menu.

    • All the items with the same difference.

      • For items found only in the source folder, choose Select > Items Only in Source from the Item or context menu.

      • For items found only in the target folder, choose Select> Items Only in Target from the Item or context menu.

      • For non-identical items found in both the source and target folders, choose Select > All Items Needing Merge from the Item or context menu.

    • Items with the ability to merge.

      • For items that have changed in one or both views, choose Select > All Items Needing Merge from the Item or context menu.

      • For items in the source folder that can be merged (because the items have changed in both views or only in the target view), choose Select > Source Items Needing Merge from the Item or context menu.

      • For items in the target folder that can be merged (because the items have changed in both views or only in the source view), choose Select > Target Items Needing Merge from the Item or context menu.

    Note: If you have not selected the Use Merge Tracking for Merge Resolution option, the All Items Needing Merge, Source Items Needing Merge, and Target Items Needing Merge options all result in the same selection. They select all the items that have changed in one or both views.
